etymologies: late Middle English (in an earlier sense). From un- + proper

definitions: Specifically. Of language, a word, etc.: incorrect, wrongly used. Formerly also: †figurative, not literal (obsolete).

notes.text: Later chiefly in humorous use, as a deliberately incorrect (or ‘improper’) form.

definitions: Not appropriate for particular circumstances; not in accordance with accepted standards; inappropriate, unsuitable, unacceptable.
Specifically. Not in accordance with good manners or decorum; indecent, immodest.
